026 package de.general.json;
027 
028 
029 import java.io.BufferedReader;
030 import java.io.IOException;
031 import java.io.InputStream;
032 import java.io.InputStreamReader;
033 import java.io.Reader;
034 import java.io.StringReader;
035 
036 
037 /*
038 Copyright (c) 2002 JSON.org

041 of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal

061 /**
062 * A JSONTokener takes a source string and extracts characters and tokens from
063 * it. It is used by the JSONObject and JSONArray constructors to parse
064 * JSON source strings.
065 * @author JSON.org
066 * @version 2012-02-16
067 */
068 class JSONTokener
069 {
070 
071     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
072     // Constants
073     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
074 
075     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
076     // Variables
077     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
078 
079     private long character;
080     private boolean eof;
081     private long index;
082     private long line;
083     private char previous;
084     private Reader reader;
085     private boolean usePrevious;
086 
087     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
088     // Constructors
089     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
090 
091     /**
092     * Construct a JSONTokener from a Reader.
093     *
094     * @param reader A reader.
095     */
096     protected JSONTokener(Reader reader) {
097         this.reader = reader.markSupported()
098             ? reader
099             : new BufferedReader(reader);
100         this.eof = false;
101         this.usePrevious = false;
102         this.previous = 0;
103         this.index = 0;
104         this.character = 1;
105         this.line = 1;
106     }
107 
108 
109     /**
110     * Construct a JSONTokener from an InputStream.
111     */
112     protected JSONTokener(InputStream inputStream) throws JSONException {
113         this(new InputStreamReader(inputStream));
114     }
115 
116 
117     /**
118     * Construct a JSONTokener from a string.
119     *
120     * @param s A source string.
121     */
122     protected JSONTokener(String s) {
123         this(new StringReader(s));
124     }
125 
126     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
127     // Methods
128     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
129 
130     /**
131 * Back up one character. This provides a sort of lookahead capability,
132 * so that you can test for a digit or letter before attempting to parse
133 * the next number or identifier.
134 */
135     public void back() throws JSONException {
136         if (this.usePrevious || this.index <= 0) {
137             throw new JSONException("Stepping back two steps is not supported");
138         }
139         this.index -= 1;
140         this.character -= 1;
141         this.usePrevious = true;
142         this.eof = false;
143     }
144 
145     /**
146 * Get the hex value of a character (base16).
147 * @param c A character between '0' and '9' or between 'A' and 'F' or
148 * between 'a' and 'f'.
149 * @return An int between 0 and 15, or -1 if c was not a hex digit.
150 */
151     public static int dehexchar(char c) {
152         if (c >= '0' && c <= '9') {
153             return c - '0';
154         }
155         if (c >= 'A' && c <= 'F') {
156             return c - ('A' - 10);
157         }
158         if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'f') {
159             return c - ('a' - 10);
160         }
161         return -1;
162     }
163 
164     public boolean end() {
165         return this.eof && !this.usePrevious;
166     }
167 
168 
169     /**
170 * Determine if the source string still contains characters that next()
171 * can consume.
172 * @return true if not yet at the end of the source.
173 */
174     public boolean more() throws JSONException {
175         this.next();
176         if (this.end()) {
177             return false;
178         }
179         this.back();
180         return true;
181     }
182 
183 
184     /**
185 * Get the next character in the source string.
186 *
187 * @return The next character, or 0 if past the end of the source string.
188 */
189     public char next() throws JSONException {
190         int c;
191         if (this.usePrevious) {
192             this.usePrevious = false;
193             c = this.previous;
194         } else {
195             try {
196                 c = this.reader.read();
197             } catch (IOException exception) {
198                 throw new JSONException(exception);
199             }
200 
201             if (c <= 0) { // End of stream
202                 this.eof = true;
203                 c = 0;
204             }
205         }
206         this.index += 1;
207         if (this.previous == '\r') {
208             this.line += 1;
209             this.character = c == '\n' ? 0 : 1;
210         } else if (c == '\n') {
211             this.line += 1;
212             this.character = 0;
213         } else {
214             this.character += 1;
215         }
216         this.previous = (char) c;
217         return this.previous;
218     }
219 
220 
221     /**
222 * Consume the next character, and check that it matches a specified
223 * character.
224 * @param c The character to match.
225 * @return The character.
226 * @throws JSONException if the character does not match.
227 */
228     public char next(char c) throws JSONException {
229         char n = this.next();
230         if (n != c) {
231             throw this.syntaxError("Expected '" + c + "' and instead saw '" +
232                     n + "'");
233         }
234         return n;
235     }
236 
237 
238     /**
239 * Get the next n characters.
240 *
241 * @param n The number of characters to take.
242 * @return A string of n characters.
243 * @throws JSONException
244 * Substring bounds error if there are not
245 * n characters remaining in the source string.
246 */
247      public String next(int n) throws JSONException {
248          if (n == 0) {
249              return "";
250          }
251 
252          char[] chars = new char[n];
253          int pos = 0;
254 
255          while (pos < n) {
256              chars[pos] = this.next();
257              if (this.end()) {
258                  throw this.syntaxError("Substring bounds error");
259              }
260              pos += 1;
261          }
262          return new String(chars);
263      }
264 
265 
266     /**
267 * Get the next char in the string, skipping whitespace.
268 * @throws JSONException
269 * @return A character, or 0 if there are no more characters.
270 */
271     public char nextClean() throws JSONException {
272         for (;;) {
273             char c = this.next();
274             if (c == 0 || c > ' ') {
275                 return c;
276             }
277         }
278     }
279 
280 
281     /**
282 * Return the characters up to the next close quote character.
283 * Backslash processing is done. The formal JSON format does not
284 * allow strings in single quotes, but an implementation is allowed to
285 * accept them.
286 * @param quote The quoting character, either
287 * <code>"</code>&nbsp;<small>(double quote)</small> or
288 * <code>'</code>&nbsp;<small>(single quote)</small>.
289 * @return A String.
290 * @throws JSONException Unterminated string.
291 */
292     public String nextString(char quote) throws JSONException {
293         char c;
294         StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
295         for (;;) {
296             c = this.next();
297             switch (c) {
298             case 0:
299             case '\n':
300             case '\r':
301                 throw this.syntaxError("Unterminated string");
302             case '\\':
303                 c = this.next();
304                 switch (c) {
305                 case 'b':
306                     sb.append('\b');
307                     break;
308                 case 't':
309                     sb.append('\t');
310                     break;
311                 case 'n':
312                     sb.append('\n');
313                     break;
314                 case 'f':
315                     sb.append('\f');
316                     break;
317                 case 'r':
318                     sb.append('\r');
319                     break;
320                 case 'u':
321                     sb.append((char)Integer.parseInt(this.next(4), 16));
322                     break;
323                 case '"':
324                 case '\'':
325                 case '\\':
326                 case '/':
327                     sb.append(c);
328                     break;
329                 default:
330                     throw this.syntaxError("Illegal escape.");
331                 }
332                 break;
333             default:
334                 if (c == quote) {
335                     return sb.toString();
336                 }
337                 sb.append(c);
338             }
339         }
340     }
341 
342 
343     /**
344 * Get the text up but not including the specified character or the
345 * end of line, whichever comes first.
346 * @param delimiter A delimiter character.
347 * @return A string.
348 */
349     public String nextTo(char delimiter) throws JSONException {
350         StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
351         for (;;) {
352             char c = this.next();
353             if (c == delimiter || c == 0 || c == '\n' || c == '\r') {
354                 if (c != 0) {
355                     this.back();
356                 }
357                 return sb.toString().trim();
358             }
359             sb.append(c);
360         }
361     }
362 
363 
364     /**
365 * Get the text up but not including one of the specified delimiter
366 * characters or the end of line, whichever comes first.
367 * @param delimiters A set of delimiter characters.
368 * @return A string, trimmed.
369 */
370     public String nextTo(String delimiters) throws JSONException {
371         char c;
372         StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
373         for (;;) {
374             c = this.next();
375             if (delimiters.indexOf(c) >= 0 || c == 0 ||
376                     c == '\n' || c == '\r') {
377                 if (c != 0) {
378                     this.back();
379                 }
380                 return sb.toString().trim();
381             }
382             sb.append(c);
383         }
384     }
385 
386 
387     /**
388 * Get the next value. The value can be a Boolean, Double, Integer,
389 * JSONArray, JSONObject, Long, or String, or the JSONObject.NULL object.
390 * @throws JSONException If syntax error.
391 *
392 * @return An object.
393 */
394     public Object nextValue() throws JSONException {
395         char c = this.nextClean();
396         String string;
397 
398         switch (c) {
399             case '"':
400             case '\'':
401                 return this.nextString(c);
402             case '{':
403                 this.back();
404                 return new JSONObject(this);
405             case '[':
406                 this.back();
407                 return new JSONArray(this);
408         }
409 
410         /*
411 * Handle unquoted text. This could be the values true, false, or
412 * null, or it can be a number. An implementation (such as this one)
413 * is allowed to also accept non-standard forms.
414 *
415 * Accumulate characters until we reach the end of the text or a
416 * formatting character.
417 */
418 
419         StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
420         while (c >= ' ' && ",:]}/\\\"[{;=#".indexOf(c) < 0) {
421             sb.append(c);
422             c = this.next();
423         }
424         this.back();
425 
426         string = sb.toString().trim();
427         if ("".equals(string)) {
428             throw this.syntaxError("Missing value");
429         }
430         return JSONObject.stringToValue(string);
431     }
432 
433 
434     /**
435 * Skip characters until the next character is the requested character.
436 * If the requested character is not found, no characters are skipped.
437 * @param to A character to skip to.
438 * @return The requested character, or zero if the requested character
439 * is not found.
440 */
441     public char skipTo(char to) throws JSONException {
442         char c;
443         try {
444             long startIndex = this.index;
445             long startCharacter = this.character;
446             long startLine = this.line;
447             this.reader.mark(1000000);
448             do {
449                 c = this.next();
450                 if (c == 0) {
451                     this.reader.reset();
452                     this.index = startIndex;
453                     this.character = startCharacter;
454                     this.line = startLine;
455                     return c;
456                 }
457             } while (c != to);
458         } catch (IOException exc) {
459             throw new JSONException(exc);
460         }
461 
462         this.back();
463         return c;
464     }
465 
466 
467     /**
468 * Make a JSONException to signal a syntax error.
469 *
470 * @param message The error message.
471 * @return A JSONException object, suitable for throwing
472 */
473     public JSONException syntaxError(String message) {
474         return new JSONException(message + this.toString());
475     }
476 
477 
478     /**
479 * Make a printable string of this JSONTokener.
480 *
481 * @return " at {index} [character {character} line {line}]"
482 */
483     public String toString() {
484         return " at " + this.index + " [character " + this.character + " line " +
485             this.line + "]";
486     }
487 
488 }
  JavaDoq: JSONTokener.java
